summary.text:
LUMINA ENGINE

The main entry point for the Lumina presentation library.
Initializes the Vue application, sets up the store, and manages the component lifecycle.
Creates a new Lumina instance.
CSS selector for the container element (e.g. '#app').
Configuration options (theme, loop, keys, etc.).
CSS selector for the container element (e.g. '#app').
Navigation API
Checks if the speaker notes window is currently open.
Closes the speaker notes window if open.

Feature: Feedback Loop
Exports the current session state for LLM consumption.
Includes: Narrative Log, Context Window, and Interest "Heatmap".

Loads a Deck object into the engine.
Use this to start the presentation or switch decks dynamically.
The Deck object containing meta and slides.
Unsubscribes from an engine event.
Event name.
The callback function to remove.

Subscribes to an engine event.
Wrapper around the internal EventBus.
Event name ('ready', 'slideChange', 'action', 'error').
Callback function.

Opens the speaker notes in a new window.
Establishes bidirectional sync via BroadcastChannel.

content.text: The popup window reference, or null if blocked by browser

summary.text:
Feature: Diff Updates
Updates the existing deck with partial changes.
Gets current connection status.
Cleans up resources and removes the instance from the cache.
Notifies other windows that this window is closing.
Subscribes to connection status changes.
Sends a ping to check if another window is listening.
Sends a message to all connected windows on this channel.
Subscribes to incoming messages.
Destroys all active channel instances.

Gets or creates a SpeakerChannel instance for the given name.
Uses singleton pattern to ensure one channel per name, unless forceNew is true.
The unique ID for the channel
If true, creates a new instance even if one exists (needed for in-context communication)
Checks if BroadcastChannel is supported in the current environment.
Payload for the 'action' event (e.g. button clicks).

This is the primary data structure passed to
`engine.load()`

Global toggle for animations.
Stagger delay between sequential elements in seconds.
The style of entry animation for slide elements.
Map of event names to their payload types.
Fired when a user interaction occurs.

Custom keyboard shortcuts.

Whether to loop back to the start after the last slide.

Theme configuration object or preset name string.
Enable/Disable touch swipe gestures.
UI element toggles.

Slide: Custom HTML
Renders arbitrary HTML content fullscreen.
Use with caution - HTML is injected directly.
Optional scoped CSS styles

Unique ID for keying loop optimization (optional).

Speaker notes for this slide (supports basic markdown).
Sizing mode: 'viewport' (100vh) or 'container' (100%). Default: 'viewport'

Slide: Features Layout
A grid of feature cards.
List of feature cards to display.
Unique ID for keying loop optimization (optional).
Slide-specific metadata.
Speaker notes for this slide (supports basic markdown).
Sizing mode: 'viewport' (100vh) or 'container' (100%). Default: 'viewport'

Slide: Split/Half Layout
Text on one side, image on the other.

content.text:
```json
{
  "type": "half",
  "imageSide": "left",
  "image": "https://example.com/photo.jpg",
  "title": "Smart Split Layouts",
  "paragraphs": ["Lumina adapts to viewport size.", "Content is King."],
  "cta": "Read Documentation"
}
```

summary.text: Unique ID for keying loop optimization (optional).
Which side the image appears on.
Slide-specific metadata.
Speaker notes for this slide (supports basic markdown).
Sizing mode: 'viewport' (100vh) or 'container' (100%). Default: 'viewport'

Metadata for individual slides.
Can contain arbitrary data used by custom layouts.

Slide: Statement Layout
A simple, high-impact text layout.

content.text:
```json
{
  "type": "statement",
  "meta": { "orbColor": "#3b82f6" },
  "tag": "Declarative Engine",
  "title": "Lumina V8",
  "subtitle": "A highly modular, performance-first presentation engine."
}
```

readme.text:
# Lumina Engine


The Interface Layer for the Agentic Era

Stop making your AI write HTML.
Lumina turns "fuzzy" Agent thoughts into
cinematic, 60fps GPU-accelerated experiences.

Quick Start Layout Gallery

"> Agent Guide

[![Version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/lumina-slides?style=for-the-badge&color=2563EB)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/lumina-slides) [![Downloads](https://img.shields.io/npm/dt/lumina-slides?style=for-the-badge&color=7C3AED)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/lumina-slides) [![License](https://img.shields.io/github/license/PailletJuanPablo/lumina-slides?style=for-the-badge&color=DB2777)](https://github.com/PailletJuanPablo/lumina-slides/blob/main/LICENSE) [![TypeScript](https://img.shields.io/badge/Written%20In-TypeScript-blue?style=for-the-badge&logo=typescript)](https://www.typescriptlang.org/)
## The Problem

The Old Way

Models hallucinate HTML/CSS.

Broken layouts.

Ugly, non-responsive designs.

Huge token cost.

The Lumina Way

Model outputs Intent (JSON).

Engine handles Execution (Renderer).

Guaranteed 60fps & Responsive.

Tiny token footprint.
### Architecture

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[ AI Agent] -->|Streams JSON| B(Lumina Engine)
    B -->|Normalizes| C{Layout System}
    C -->|Timeline| D[Render Slide]
    C -->|Flex| D
    C -->|Features| D
    D -->|60fps| E[ User Screen]
    E -->|Click Event| A
    style A fill:#e1f5fe,stroke:#01579b,stroke-width:2px
    style B fill:#e8f5e9,stroke:#2e7d32,stroke-width:2px,color:#000
    style E fill:#fff3e0,stroke:#ef6c00,stroke-width:2px
```

---

##  Layouts & Gallery

Lumina comes with **"Pro" Layouts** built-in. Your agent just needs to pick the
| | | **Features** | A powerful grid system for benefits, stats, or KPIs. Automatically adapts to the number of items.
| | | **Timeline** | Chronological events, roadmaps, or history. Horizontal scrolling with snap points.
| | | **Steps** | Numbered process flows, tutorials, or "How-To" guides.
| | | **Half** | Visual context. Image on one side, text on the other. Responsive.
| | | **Chart** | Data visualization with Chart.js. Bar, line, pie, doughnut charts.
| | | **Embedded** | **Widget Mode**. Embed slides inside dashboards or smaller containers.

| | > [!TIP] > **See the Code**: Click on the dropdowns below to see the exact JSON used to generate these slides.
Example: Timeline JSON

</details>

---

##  Theming

Lumina includes **6 beautiful theme presets** out-of-the-box. Just pass the name:

| Theme | Description | Preview | | :----------- | :---------------------------------- | :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | **default** | Clean blue on dark. Professional. | | | **ocean** | Cyan on slate. Calm and focused. | | | **midnight** | Indigo on black. Bold and dramatic. | | | **forest** | Emerald greens. Natural and fresh. | | | **cyber** | Neon pink. Sci-fi futuristic. | | | **latte** | Light mode. Warm amber on cream. | | --- ## Quick Start ### 1. Install

### 2. Implementation

Lumina is a **Framework Agnostic** class. It mounts to any DOM node.

---

##  Building Agents?

We have a dedicated guide for that.

> [!IMPORTANT] > **Read the [Agent Integration Guide](

)**
>
> Learn about:
>
> - **Streaming**: How to pipe token streams directly into the engine.
> - **Aliases**: Improve latency by 30% using

.
> - **Feedback Loops**: How to let the AI know what the user is clicking.

### Token Optimization

Lumina includes a built-in normalizer. Your LLM can output "lazy" JSON to save money.

| Concept        | Standard     | Short Alias |
| :------------- | :----------- | :---------- |
| **Header**     |

Replaces the entire deck. Use this for the initial load.

###

Updates **parts** of the deck. Use this for:

- Real-time streaming (appending slides).
- Correcting typos live.
- Updating a "Status" slide based on live data.

###

---

Built with by Juan Pablo Paillet.
